channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024040561
item.description:
Report E-2024040561

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a 2-gallon release of regulated UN2810 "NOP Oregano Essential" that arrived damaged at Terminal XLF. The caller stated that a fifty-five gallon metal drum was damaged from other freight that was unsecure during transit impacting Trailer #319-3334. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The waste was overpacked with oil dri and ppe and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040555
item.description:
Report E-2024040555

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill occurred on the dock in Greencastle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 2 gallons combined from 2 separate products that were shipped in the same boxes, the products being Axalta Plastic Primer Surfacer and 2K Urethane Primer. The freight arrived at the terminal already damaged and spilling prior to arrival, likely due to improper loading by the previous terminal. A total of 4-1 gallon metal cans of product were disposed of in 2-20 gallon poly drums, and the spill was cleaned with Oil Dri. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040530
item.description:
Report E-2024040530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) cups of material was released due to improper loading that resulted in one (1) 50-pound plastic bag becoming damaged. Miller Environmental Group personnel gathered the released material and placed the recovered material and damaged bag into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040892
item.description:
Report X-2024040892

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 2.5gallon plastic bottles of convoclean forte one 2.5gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25gallons to release each bottle was in a plastic bag but no slotted partitions or absorbent were found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. Package handler Lindsey Kress in load area 6 was injury by this leaking package. when she picked up the package she didn't know it was wet and leaking and the contents leaked on her leg. DescribePack: one 2.5gallon plastic bottle of convoclean forte had a loose cap allowing .25gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When they were unloading the trailer, the PH realized that the box was wet and proceeded to inform the manager, who put the box in a black container inside a plastic bag. DescribePack: This box did not have any type of inner packaging and the plastic bottles did not have any protection, one of the bottles had a hole on the top of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put inside the bin and inside a plastic hazmat bag and we put absorb cloth underneath.

item.description:

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package came off trailer #952349 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1gallon plastic bottles of zep driveway & concrete cleaner concentrate one 1gallon plastic bottle had a loose and open cap allowing 1gallon to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. leaking package was discovered when package handler Evette Trosterud picked up the package not realizing that it was a leaking hazmat liquid from the leaking bottle got on her arms and cloths. DescribePack: one 1gallon plastic bottle of zep driveway & concrete cleaner concentrate had a loose and open cap allowing 1 gallon to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024040853
item.description:
Report X-2024040853

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was transported from unload to van line on tugger cart, once it arrived at line it was unloaded and placed on top of an IC , then another heavy IC was placed on top and crushed the HazMat package. Being sandwiched between 2 heavy IC's crushed contents and it began to leak at closure cap. Poor handling by package handlers. DescribePack: Top of heavy plastic bag at cap, began to leak from pressure of being sandwiched between two heavy IC's . Leakage was at the top and cap location. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once it was noticed HazMat package was leaking, it was moved to HazMat cage and placed in white salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040929
item.description:
Report X-2024040929

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded by a package handler during the outbound sort. Package handler noticed that box was wet and manager retrieved box and placed in QA to be processed. DescribePack: The box was wet around the corner and it appears that the lid of one bottle was slightly loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lids were tightened and package was placed in a hazmat bin to be processed.
